items.sentence: I\'ll go to the grocery store across the street.
I\'ll have to stay behind and help Tom clean up.
Tom is single and has a three-year-old daughter.
Tom is very good at doing things with his hands.
I want to know when you\'re planning to do that.
Do you think I don\'t want what\'s best for Tom?
I looked Tom in the eyes and told him the truth.
Go to your room and wait there until I call you.
I don\'t think that Tom has a driver\'s license.
Tom adopted a dog from the local animal shelter.
Tom always orders the cheapest item on the menu.
I want to be just like my father when I grow up.
Tom had to wait a long time in the waiting room.
It was a lot tougher than I thought it would be.
It was easy for Tom to convince Mary to do that.
You haven\'t told us why Tom doesn\'t like Mary.
You know Tom is a friend of Mary\'s, don\'t you?
Three customers came in just as we were closing.
Tom asked Mary to teach him how to do the waltz.
Tom asked me if I would help him move his piano.
